about.sectionTitle: In Pursuit of Light, an exhibition of Albert Einstein's works
about.paragraph: Our understanding of time and space was revolutionized by Albert Einstein’s discoveries. With special relativity, he demonstrated that time is not absolute but flows differently depending on an observer’s speed. General relativity later revealed that gravity bends spacetime, affecting the path of light and shaping the very structure of the universe. From the thought experiment of a moving train to the gravitational bending of light, this exhibition invites you to explore the groundbreaking concepts that transformed our perception of reality.
about.imgfooter: Albert Einstein, born on March 14, 1879 in Ulm.

faq.question1: What is the duration of the exhibition?
faq.answer1: The exhibition lasts about 1 hour, but you can spend more time depending on your interest.
faq.question2: Do I need to book in advance?
faq.answer2: Yes, entry is free, but reservation is mandatory.
faq.answer3: The exhibition is open daily from 10 AM to 6 PM.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.description: Lunastra is committed to protecting the personal data of its users. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and share the personal data you provide us.

sections.title: Use of personal data
sections.content: We use your personal data to respond to your requests, confirm your reservations, or inform you about our services. We do not sell your personal data to third parties.

sections.title: Sharing of personal data
sections.content: We do not share your personal data with third parties, unless necessary to fulfill a specific request you have made.

sections.title: Retention of personal data
sections.content: We retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill your request. We delete personal data from our systems once it is no longer needed.

sections.title: Security of personal data
sections.content: We take measures to protect your personal data from loss, theft, misuse, or unauthorized access. We use security measures such as data encryption and strong password policies to protect your data.

sections.content: You have the right to request access and rectification of your personal data. To do so, please contact us at the email address contact@lunastra.fr or the postal address listed above (see legal notices).

sections.title: Changes to the privacy policy

sections.title: Contact us
